channel.title: Summary :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: In this chapter, we explored the Hyper-Text Transfer Protocol (HTTP), the technology used to exchange data across the web. We saw how requests and responses are simply well-structured streams of text or data exchanged across a packet-switched network. We examined the structure of these requests, and saw how they all use a similar pattern of a request or response line, a series of headers carrying metadata about the request or response, and an optional body.
